intro: Cupaniopsis induta, commonly known as the velvetleaf hakea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in shrubland and woodland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and they bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Cupaniopsis induta is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to different environmental conditions.
